intro: Chenopodium neoalbum, commonly known as white goosefoot, is a species of flowering plant in the family Amaranthaceae. It is native to North America and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that are typically pale green to white in color. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and other open areas. Chenopodium neoalbum is an annual plant that is sometimes considered a weed due to its rapid growth and adaptability.
